intro: Gaudinia maroccana var. hirtiglumis, commonly known as the Moroccan gaudinia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to drought conditions.
